newsitem.title: USA: Living Centers, GranCare set $1.8 billion merger.
newsitem.headline: Living Centers, GranCare set $1.8 billion merger.

text.p: Living Centers of America Inc. and GranCare Inc. said Thursday they agreed to a $1.8 billion merger that will create the second-largest long-term care provider in the United States.

Under the agreement, Living Centers shareholders will receive $40.50 a share in cash. After a recapitalization, GranCare shareholders will own 49.5 percent of the new company, Apollo Management LP, an investment group, will own 39.3 percent and Living Centers shareholders 11.2 percent, the companies said.

The merged company will operate 330 facilities with more than 38,000 beds in 21 states, providing long-term care, drug and rehabilitation services, assisted living and speciality health care services.
Houston-based Living Centres provides health care services to senior citizens. GranCare, based in Atlanta, offers speciality medical and long-term care services.
As part of the recapitalization, Apollo will invest $200 million to buy newly issued stock in the new company.

The board of the combined company will include two directors from Living Centers' board, four directors from GranCare and four members named by Apollo. The new board will select a management team of executives from both companies, the companies said.
